Members of Congress should not be allowed to own individual stock.

We are here to serve the public, not to profiteer. It’s shocking that it’s even been allowed up to this point.

Trump is not listening. The lack of coronavirus testing is a big problem in California and across the country. https://twitter.com/mkraju/status/1241051325271543811 QT @mkraju “I’m not hearing it,” Trump says when asked about Americans who want to get a coronavirus test but can’t get a test

My soul, be at rest in God alone,from whom comes my hope.

Psalms 62:6
To the health care workers fighting for all of us—nurses, doctors, aides, therapists, dining services, housekeeping, maintenance, administrative staff, and so many more—I see you. I love you.

One enormous, major lesson that I hope people realize in this moment:

Resistance to revolutionary policy was never really about a lack of money, or capacity, or logistics.

It was always about power and a lack of political will.

RT @HaleyLive UPDATE: Spoke to hospital exec. 

They have lost $39M in a month. 

Some in their group have 1-2 months before they will close doors. 

We shouldn’t get to the point of hospital shutdowns to compel fed govt to secure the medical & fiscal solvency of this nation.
RT @shamuskhan As 2.5M lose their jobs in the middle of a pandemic, remind me again why we binding health insurance to employment is a good idea.

RT @GovMurphy BREAKING: We’re requiring hospitals and Federally Qualified Health Centers to WAIVE patient #COVID19 testing fees for the uninsured.

The last thing that DHS should be prioritizing right now is preparing for mass deportations of DREAMers. With the Supreme Court decision expected by June, my colleagues and I sent a letter today demanding answers about what DHS intends to do.

RT @alextdaugherty .@marcorubio has been working on a small business #coronavirus plan for the last few weeks. The plan, which includes $300b for employers with less than 500 employees to meet payroll, will likely be part of $1 trillion Senate bill: https://www.miamiherald.com/news/coronavirus/article241367601.html

In this crisis, we have got to pay more attention to the most vulnerable. Mothers are skipping meals to feed their kids right now. Who’s going to respond to them?

We must guarantee the health, nutrition, shelter, and economic wellbeing of all our people.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/20/us/coronavirus-poverty-school-lunch.html

Brittany, thank you for being open and honest about the toll this pandemic is having on your mental health. There are so many people out there right now who are facing the same challenges. #AllInThisTogether
https://twitter.com/brittanys/status/1241107222203113472 QT @brittanys I have depression. I’m generally well equipped to handle it during normal courses of business. But coronavirus has shattered many of my coping mechanisms. 

I’d like to share how I’m dealing so that others also struggling can feel a little less alone.

I’m hosting a virtual roundtable on the economic and health crises created by the coronavirus outbreak. Join me, musical guests @andrecymone @NahkoBear, and two leaders on the frontlines of the crisis - @FlyingWithSara and @SaruJayaraman. https://www.pscp.tv/w/cUPwZjMyNzU3OTl8MWxQS3FWcUFsem5HYoQpbCmz9KIVisOVuzD3p_5_I33AZWE4XCSpJ4boTkm5

The shiny object in the press is plans to give $ to big name corporations & govt checks to people. 

But the most important & urgent need to is keep the small/mid-size employers most Americans work for from going under. 

The plan is detailed on 5 part threat 1/5

How will we deal with the economic impact of #CoronaVirus and how do the solutions being discussed differ from TARP? 

@MichaelJKnowles and I discuss on the newest episode of #Verdict: http://www.VerdictPodcast.com

RT @cbs11jack #NEW From #Texas Senator @tedcruz @CBSDFW https://twitter.com/sentedcruz/status/1241038690656432137 QT @SenTedCruz I just sent a letter to @HHSGov @SecAzar urging him to use the Defense Production Act to immediately order the production and distribution of ventilators, which are critical to treating individuals infected by COVID-19.

The Senate GOP's plan to send checks will ignore many of our neediest:

A couple making $150K—$2,400
A senior getting $18K from Social Security—$600
Undocumented parents with citizen children—$0
Someone living off disability payments—$0
A student in 2018 who just got laid off—$0

I know there’s a lot of #COVID19 information out there. If you have any questions about the federal coronavirus response efforts, please comment below. I will take your questions and answer what I can in a subsequent video.

RT @PeterWelch I have been hearing from Vermonters around the world that they are not getting the support they need to come home. This is unacceptable. Today @SenSanders and I called on the State Department to bring our friends and neighbors home now! #coronavirus #vtpoli http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETj3S2gXQAIa05D.jpg

If you’re out there on the front lines—or staying at home—thank you. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETkb7ICXgAE0LYs.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1241052349591928834/vid/320x320/GnCKyEVT6HKeql98.mp4?tag=13

People are losing their jobs & their small business. 

And all we hear about is how much some huge company is going to get or about fights over the proper name for the virus. 

Can we please focus on getting cash to these small businesses so they pay their workers again. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1241187410790277120/pu/img/fbht9tfoQBfX7A8Z.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1241187410790277120/pu/vid/320x494/PMZfmwgmcQqGlRWe.mp4?tag=10

Most Americans don’t work for a Fortune 1000 corporation. They work for the small or mid-size business that are shutting down not 30 days from now,  but by the hour. 

If we don’t act fast on our plan to get them cash QUICKLY the number of people out of work will be staggering.

It’s been almost 8 years since Austin Tice, a Texan and Marine veteran, was kidnapped in Syria. I will continue to work for his immediate release, and support @realDonaldTrump admin efforts to secure it. #FreeAustinTice https://twitter.com/anitakumar01/status/1240663205573210112 QT @anitakumar01 .@POTUS asks Syria to release Austin Tice, former @mclatchy and @washingtonpost journalist, captured in that country. @FreeAustinTice

It’s important we realize how this virus hasn’t just created new problems; but poured gasoline on the crises we’ve long had.

It’s okay if you didn’t see the extreme urgency of our healthcare, housing, wage, carceral, FPol,etc crises before. But I hope you don’t unsee them later.

We need to rapidly ramp up our ability to test for coronavirus. That means we need to keep up the pressure to ensure we have enough testing kits, testing locations, and resources in our communities. Keep calling your representatives. Keep the pressure up.

Now with #COVID19 spreading in Venezuela, they face even more serious health risks. The #Citgo6 should be released right away on humanitarian grounds. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETeQXvNXkAA2RtL.jpg

If mass evictions are a crisis now, why wasn’t the highest homelessness % since the Depression one too?

Too little, too late.

to get 💰 to small/mid size employers in a matter of days (not weeks). If they use it to keep their workers on payroll they DO NOT have to pay it back. 2/5

Yesterday I announced I’m calling for the Federal Bureau of Prisons to release low-risk incarcerated individuals. Not only will it help keep those vulnerable safer from coronavirus, it’s the right thing to do.

Deeply saddened by this news. Larry was the audio technician for the @NBCnews team dispatched to cover my 2012 campaign. He was a special part of the Romney Rambler family. Ann and I send our prayers to Larry’s wife, Crystal, his sons, and loved ones. https://twitter.com/garretthaake/status/1240994164612923392 QT @GarrettHaake The man on the left is Larry Edgeworth. I met him as the sound tech on our team that covered the Romney campaign in 2012. He called me “slim,” and helped me put together my first resume tape. He was SO proud of his kids. He was hilarious. Yesterday he lost his fight with COVID-19 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETjlnGuXYAEPPhC.jpg

Let’s take this lesson and move it forward to push for a better world.

We CAN guarantee healthcare.
We CAN treat housing as a right.
We CAN pursue decarceral policy.
We CAN prioritize humanitarian foreign policy.
We can. We can. We can.

We need to cover 100% of the costs of uninsured & underinsured people right now.

Not just Coronavirus bills, either - getting sick can set off a domino effect of complications.

It’s barbaric to bankrupt people over healthcare & medicine they need to live.

Always has been. #M4A https://twitter.com/abbyvesoulis/status/1240994625739018253 QT @abbyvesoulis An uninsured COVID-19 patient just got her medical bill: $34,927.43. @abbyabrams has the story. https://time.com/5806312/coronavirus-treatment-cost/

Over 1,500 Amazon employees have publicly voiced their concerns that Amazon is not doing enough to protect its staff during the #COVID19 outbreak, putting not just their workers at risk but the country. I, along with my colleagues, just sent this letter requesting answers. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETlT4AVWsAUGia-.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETlT4AUXQAEbz2V.png

Goal is to quicklyprovide employers enough cash to keep workers on payroll & bring back laid off workers onto payroll,for the next 5 to 6 weeks. Keeping your paycheck,even if the govt isn’t allowing you to work is far better use than forcing people to get unemployment checks. 3/5

Any taxpayer money that goes to bail out big companies must go directly to workers, not to stock buybacks or executive bonuses. Read my new op-ed on my 8 rules for those companies so we put workers & taxpayers first.  https://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/2020/03/20/coronavirus-elizabeth-warren-republican-bailout-plans-dont-protect-workers-column/2888189001/

In the richest country in world history, our medical workers do not even have the masks, gloves, ventilators and protections they need right now.

We need to fundamentally change the dysfunctionality, stupidity and irrationality of the current system. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/19/health/coronavirus-masks-shortage.html

We cannot leave the most vulnerable behind. Congress MUST stand up for those who are hurting the most.

Yesterday I introduced a bill to use FEMA resources to help millions more with unemployment, food, child care, and medical assistance. We must pass it—now.

The 2008 Wall Street bailout ignored ordinary Americans.
 
Now, Senate Republicans are pushing a plan that does nothing for 22 million Americans making less than $40,000.
 
Let us learn from history. Let us focus on the working families in this country. https://slate.com/business/2020/03/the-republican-plan-to-mail-checks-to-everyone-still-found-a-way-to-screw-the-poor.html

Once again, the MA delegation is urging @HHSgov to grant MA's request for supplies from the Strategic National Stockpile. https://www.wgbh.org/news/local-news/2020/03/19/sen-warren-mass-delegation-urge-federal-government-to-restock-hospitals-with-protective-gear
